change.item: Edited by Bonnie Gordon to reflect updated administrative information and changed title

did.unittitle: Collection of Mary K. Simkhovitch Correspondence

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material at the Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Mary Kingsbury Simkhovitch (1867-1951) was one of the founders and longtime head of Greenwich House, a social settlement house in the Greenwhich Village area of New York City.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This small collection contains some of the correspondence of Simkhovitch, and letters to Simkovitch, including one from Harry S. Truman.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Donated by Betty Caroli. The accession number associated with this collection is 2008.037.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The Tamiment Library does not have information about who owns copyright to this collection. Materials in this collection created by Mary K. Simkhovitch are expected to enter the public domain in 2021. The Tamiment Library is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection.
